text: The dry hopped stuff from Caldera is my favorite and this beer is no exception. Nice color good taste. Ill get it again.

Draught @ BeerTemple, Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 250, Amsterdam, Netherlands 1012 RR. [ As Caldera Dry Hop Red ].Clear medium to dark brown - red amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, dark malt, moderate hoppy, orange - citrus, fruity. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, grass, hoppy, dark malt, sweet malt, fruity, vomit notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150923]
Keg at the beer temple... Copper... Thin white lacing... Soft sweet toffee fruit.. Soft sweet toffee toffee fruit.. Soft malts

[9/22/15] Draught at Beer Temple in Amsterdam. Clear amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, sourish fruits. Sweetish flavor with malt, caramel, a bit of sourish fruits, and a bitter hops finish. Medium-bodied. Off.
Keg at the beer temple. Pours deep red, nose is toffee, floral, fruity, taste is dry, sweet toffee, floral.
Not too special too me. A little oxidised, maybe the beer was old. Quite bitter, some caramel, but not too impressive.
Poured bright reddish brown with a tan head. Aroma of sweet berries and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.
Clear dark red brown colour. Strong aroma full of sweet red fruit also thyme. Flavour has bittersweet caramel and red fruit. A well moderated hop bitterness. Perfectly sessionable and very re

Dark red ale with an assertive aroma of floral hops, tropical fruits (papaya, pineapple). Sweet character. Wonderful blend of fruity hop and bright bready malts. Complex and flavourful, a top notch session brew.

Pours a thin head with a clear amber colored body.
The aroma is wonderful pine and grapefruit. Simple but done well.
The taste is moderate bitter pine and lemon all the way through.
The texture is crisp with soft edges and moderate carbonation.
Great smell and taste.

Pours clear amber finger white fluffy head.

Smell sweet hoppy caramel

Taste very hoppy, floral, bite on tail

Light body

Nice
I liked this one a lot.  Nice and hoppy throughout the whole beer.  Mild malt and body for the main part of the brew.  Hints at pine in there.  Yumsauce.

On tap at Baileys Taproom. Deep red pour with a very tiny white head. Nice fruit flavor with a solid pine hop bite. Very good smelling and tasting and well balanced. Caldera kept winning with me until I tried the Pils...

Tap @ Bailys taproom. Pours a dark red (not amber) color with a small white head. This beer was nice and subtle. Hints of toffee and grass. the hops made themselves known before fading nicely into the matiness of the beer... good red ale.

Tap @ Horse Brass Pub...  Poured dark red with a thin off-white head.  Smooth palate with mild carbonation.  Some soapy undertones and dry hops for a nice bitterness.  Other caramel malt flavors and maybe toffee.
In a glass it is a really pretty beer. But proves that an incredibly good red can come from a can.
On draft at the Laurelhurst Brew and View.  Went alright with the specialty pizza and was more than the $3 ticket.  More commendable than the film (Atonement) IMO.

Draft at Horse Brass: Small white head, dark dark amber red color. Aroma of slightly fruity malts and citrusy hops. Flavor is moderately malty and has notes of fruity esters, moderate hop bitterness and citrus and floral hop flavors, i am picking up some amarillo. Very clean and very crisp. Nearing ipa levels of hops. Just a very good and drinkable ale.

On tap at Horse Brass. Rich red copper colour. Nice lasting foam. Gorgeous hop aroma. Caramel and hop flavours. Delicious. I really enjoy the blending of styles in the PNW. I want a keg of this at home.

What a great beer!  Deep copper coloring almost red with an off white sticky head.  Aroma is fruit and almost akin to walking into a flower garden.  Sweet and floral throughout, with a rich and sweet maltiness that is creamy and nutty, with some great doughiness and a  nice hop level as well.  Just this side of wonderful.

On tap, Siskiyou Micro Pub, AshlandDark red ale with an assertive aroma of florals, tropical fruits (papaya, pineapple).  Sweet character.  Wonderful blend of fruity hop and bright breadcrusty malts.  Complex and flavourful, a top notch session brew.

This is a great hoppy brew, a bit too hoppy for an amber. Pours a slightly cloudy copper with a tall smooth white head. Lots of citrus hops, slightly spicy with just a bit of maltiness in the aroma. Taste starts with just a quick malt hint then finishes with a great citrus hop dry finish. The dryhopping really allows this brew to be refreshingly hoppy without being overly bitter. A great brew for some easy drinkin.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2004 Dark red-copper color with a dense white head.  Fruity hop aroma with a hint of caramel. Fresh hoppy flavor with some slightly toasty malt and caramel flavors balancing it out. Flavor is primarily hops though. Very tasty and hoppy rendition of a  Red Ale, could possibly even be considered and American Strong Ale.
